Thanks for passing it along Kim, I was just speaking to my wife about how
she will be too busy to do any gardening this year and that it would be a
good plan for me to start reading up on it now... getting ideas etc. I will
look for the book you mentioned for sure!

messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the info.  I ve heard of it, and almost bought it a couple of times. now I will. Love hearing reviews! Ann
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the info. I've heard of it, and almost bought it a couple of times.
now I will.
Love hearing reviews!
Ann

> yummy and the gardening ideas sound like they are magical. The sunflower
> house is described, along with several other cool things. I think we are
> going to try to grow the Moon Tent. It was fascinating to read about night
> time gardening. I'm going to go buy the book tonight. I just LOVE finding a
> really terrific book!
>
> **** Kim ****

I found this book in Dec and bought it for myself. I haven't even let the
kids see it yet. Now, if I can just get up from this computer to actually
go DO some of those gardens. <G>

messages.subject: Roots, Shoots, Buckets, and Boots
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All, Has anyone read this book? - Roots, Shoots, Buckets, and Boots by Sharon Lovejoy.  I checked it out from the library last night and it is just
messages.messageBody:
Hi All,

Has anyone read this book? - Roots, Shoots, Buckets, and Boots by Sharon
Lovejoy. I checked it out from the library last night and it is just
gorgeous. It's about gardening with children. The illustrations are just
yummy and the gardening ideas sound like they are magical. The sunflower
house is described, along with several other cool things. I think we are
going to try to grow the Moon Tent. It was fascinating to read about night
time gardening. I'm going to go buy the book tonight. I just LOVE finding a
really terrific book!

**** Kim ****
runs with scissors
